Prologue: A large golden dragon stands on the edge of cliff, moonlight dancing off his scales. Stars light up the sky like fireflies in the marsh and all is still and quiet.
         "With nights like this you'd almost forget the evil on this land." Came a woman's voice from behind the dragon
         "You know you shouldn't be wandering about where others could see you." The dragon responds
         "Don't change the subject you promised it would be this year and my people cannot wai-"
         "I know what I promised but these things take time!" He retorts
         "We must do this soon if we hope to do it at all." She responds. There is silence once again and a still breeze wanders through the air, gently causing the woman's golden hair to roll like waves of amber across her face. The dragon thinks for a moment then responds
         "Alight we do this tomorrow you bring your candidates and I'll bring mine."
         "Deal." The woman answers and then sinks back into shadow. The dragon is left alone with only the whispering wind to share his thoughts with.

You then look to a student on your right and question him. "This is the first time I've been here. Is this the first time something like this has happened?"

"Once something similar occurred to me when was going to the Hallow for the first time. It was strange and kind of frightening. A messenger just showed up at my house and said the session had been canceled."said the boy.

"Did he ever say why?' you ask.

"No. Magic and dragon training is one of the most important things in the kingdom,"

"Something very mysterious is going on. Oh, and my name is Joshua."

"Nice to meet you. I'm Tidus. You're right, something is in the midst of happening and something bad too I think," he said.

"Where do you live Tidus?"

"A little way down the cobblestone path right before the well next to the store hut,"said Tidus.

"Really? I live a few houses down past the store in front of the same wall," you say.

Their conversation was broken by a a tall guard with a shinny chain mail. "You kids should get home. It will be late soon," said the guard

You and Tidus look at him curiously. "But sir it's only two hours past noon,"you say.

"It's time for you to leave nonetheless. Go straight home Okay?" the guard said.

"As you say sir, " you say as you and your new friend walk out of the Hallow.

"They're keeping something from us. We have a right to know. I' intend to find out what,"yo say.

"I really think we should listen to him and go home," Tidus said.

"Don't you want to know what's going on?" you say.

"Yes, but we can't just disobey a royal guard. Besides our parents would know we're gone," Tidus says.

"Not if we're gone when they think were asleep" you say.

"You're not serious!"

"Come on Tidus, friends should stick together."

Tidus was moved to hear you say that and looked at his feet. "I'm a nobody. No one has ever wanted to be my friend. You're the first person to approach me like you did."

"You think too lowly of yourself," you say to him. "The king and queen have no right to keep secrets from their people."

"You're right about that. If I did choose to come whet exactly would we be doing,"said Tidus

"Just a little eves dropping back at the Hallow. I have this feeling that something peculiar is taking place there. All we have to do is sneak out after bedtime and go there. I'll bring a low lighted lantern and meet you out side your house," you say.

As you look at the two remaining dragons you feel a pull inside your chest. You decide to follow the feeling and it directs you towards the dragon Osiris. As you near him you hear a deep hum emanate from his chest, and an even deeper voice comes forth uttering a single word. "Joshua." You immediately feel a bond between you, knowing that you already trust that voice with your very life you step forward and touch Osiris on the snout.

Instantly there is a blinding flash of light that only lasts a second but seems an eternity. A life flashes before your eyes, a life not your own. You feel the power in your talons and the strength in your wings as you soar over the great forests and mountains. You know the thrill of the hunt, the feeling of a dying breath between your teeth. Still more scenes flash before your eyes and in the space of several seconds you have lived another lifetime.

As your sight returns you realize that you are also seated upon Osiris' neck as Patricia was upon Venus. Immediately a feeling of peace and happiness overcomes you, and a smile spreads across your face, knowing that you have a companion that will never leave you or let you down.

As you look over you see Zack seated upon Loki as well. Beck looks at the six of you and nods. "Well I'll give you an hour or so to get to know each other, although I feel some progress has been made on that front already." he said with a chuckle as he exited the room.

1121.content:
"Finally," you think, with a sigh of relief.

After a days work of training and conditioning, a moment to yourself has finally come along. Spreading your wings in a glorious display of your magnificent wingspan and strength, you let the afternoon wind begin to lift you as you prepare to dive from the cliffs that you call home. You hover for a bit, almost appearing as though frozen in time before plummeting downwards at unmeasurable speeds. Tears are torn from your reptilian eyes at your descent, streamlined and aerodynamic with your wings tucked in at your sides.

Pulling up and straightening out just before reaching the ground, you propel forward -- a blur of trees and fields flying by beneath you. All should be at peace right now - no worldly being, besides a dragon of course, could match your swift movements across the open expanse of land and sky. You sense another dragon behind you though, closing in on you despite the speeds you have just reached.

Your heart begins to pound. Krixos has been known to send agents out to overlook the kingdom of Karn - and although you've never seen one personally, you know that a run-in would mean more than just a friendly chat. Krixos wants information and its well-known that he will use brute force to get it.

You consider your options briefly. Glancing behind you would mean losing a significant amount of speed, but not looking would mean relying only on your dragon-sense to clue you in on what's on your tail. You choose to keep your head down and power through, using every muscle under your scales to fight against the wind.

"JASPERINE!" growls a deep and thundering voice behind you.

Its your commander.

121.content:
You yawn, waking up, rubbing your eyes. How much sleep did you get? Two, maybe three hours at the most? You hated them, those nightmares that assaulted you almost every night; a night with no dreams was one of the most blissful things in life... but anyway, what were the nightmares about? You cracked your head every morning, trying to remember, nut nothing came to mind, you just wake up your heart pounding, sweating, sometimes screaming... Normal people don't fear about sleeping, but to you, it's torture.
Opening the window you look outside; a gray sky awaited, probably a storm, usual in that region; you just can't remember the last time you had a sunny day; not that you miss them, gray skies are at the very least calming. Your stomach began protesting and you remembered you haven't eaten since midday of yesterday, so you head to the kitchen. That was one of the days you wished you had parents... or siblings... or anything... at least someone to cook for you since you were so tired. No family, no nothing, the closest thing to that had been an old man, but even your memories of him were poor. He took care of you since you can remember; his name was a real mystery, he never told you, all he asked was to call him dad, even though he told you himself he wasn't your real father. When yous asked him about how you ended with him he just changed the subject so anything about your real family was in darkness. He raised you, and even though it wasn't the usual for a girl he taught you to hunt, to fight with a sword, to aim perfectly with a bow; in that matters he was very strict and you developed quite awesome abilities for your young age. He just vanished one day; when you woke up he wasn't there anymore. You were 11 at that time, too young but still you had to care for yourself. Maybe that was why you didn't relate to much of the kids of the village, you had to grow up alone and fast, they just had to play.
Distractedly you took an apple, no motivation for cooking, and sat absently in a wooden chair. That's when your eyes caught a glimpse of a letter that had been passed under your door. That was odd to say the least; you knew the villagers, but none of them could be called your friends and surely none of them would send you a letter, unless they were going to complain about something, but since they barely saw you, you just couldn't get what could be inside.
There was only a single line written: Meet me at Kahil's Peak when the sun sets.
You turn the sheet, looking for something else, like a signature, but that was it. Many thoughts filled your mind: who sent this? was this some kind of joke? But who would play a joke on someone you don't ever see? What if they had the wrong address and someone else is waiting for this? What could be waiting At Kahil's Peak?
It was a long journey to the meeting point, so if you meant to go you had to leave now...

It was going to be a day trip through the woods that surrounded the little village of Nevalen, to find you don't know what, so you had to be prepared. You stripped of your nightgown and put on your traveling clothes: dark leather pants, a black cotton sleeveless shirt and a black cloak, never too careful about being seen, not with the actual state of the kingdom... you also wear boots and fingerless gloves; in your waist you hang your sword, bow and arrows on your back. The world had become too dangerous to go unarmed.
You leave the village as stealthy as possible; you lived with these people, but these were hard times and resources were scarce, no need of having people taken advantage of your leave and raiding your house. When was the last time the king had sent a messenger to the village? There were many complaints about how little he cared of the dire situation you were living, but you just couldn't blame him, if he was still alive. You see, with so many loses after the war with the dragons humans had feeble. The small kingdoms that remained have difficult times surviving the attack from other creatures that now occupied the former cities, creatures that were thrown of their living habitats while the golden age of humanity persisted. But that was a long time ago, now you were in the lowest levels of the food chain... You sometimes wondered why hadn't your little village had been destroyed, but then a few houses can pass unnoticed...
Finding someone in the woods was rare. People usually didn't venture outside the village, unless they were going in groups. Stories went about wild creatures that could separate a human in half with no effort, of people that were impaled with no resistance to offer... You knew what lurked in there, and the truth wasn't that far from those stories. Still you have gone to Kahil's Peak many times with no real threats: don't make a sound and you'll get out of there alive. The few times you had encountered enemies you were skilled enough to kill them before they could do any harm. You were grateful with the old man for that...

1222122.content:
What at first seemed to be a leg like a humans or a four footed beast, you see a multi-jointed furry limb as it comes from the shade. With a trembling voice and a thumping heart you speak. "Please...no...not all humans...are.. the..the same," you say.

"Ice of Iphria!" you shout sending out a blue beam of light that hits its' face with a small layer of ice. It staggers around with its' face blinded with frost. info.brief_description: Humans and Dragons have clashed and our fall from glory has begun.
info.description: In this interactive story your character is one of the last humans in the fictional land of Karn. After years of war with the dragon race, humans neared extinction. Then one of the last humans, a magician, made a truce with dragon-kind. The remaining few humans are the offspring of the magician, thus all have magic. The humans truce makes it so humans can form a magical bond with one dragon, when bonded, the pair can no longer die of old age and their magical ablilities out do any un-bonded pair. You can choose to be a male character named Joshua, or a female named Irene. This story takes place 1000 years after the Dragon-human war but for the past few years an evil dragon named Krixos has made his own kingdom separate of the kingdom of Karn and declared war on the remaining humans. The humans supposedly were wiped out but really were hidden by the kingdom of Karn. The humans have been kept secret from all but the king to avoid open war with the rebels. Should the humans be discovered the rebels would declare war on the kingdom itself. So our kind has been thought of as gone from the world, until now. One human (you) have been selected to choose a dragon and help put down this rebellion for good . Absolutely NO sexual content is permitted, and try to keep the point of view second person. No killing off the main characters too soon in the story. Dragons do not eat humans (however some may swallow them whole as a joke then get them out WITHOUT digesting them) So soft vore is allowed from time to time and try to avoid too much scat description and other gross body waste from the dragons (this may seem weird but I'm just being specific about what is not wanted in this story) Virtually no swearing is allowed (at least keep it pg 13) any pages containing the "F bomb" or "S bomb" will be deleted with no exceptions. Any pages breaking any of these rules will be deleted. Feel free to name your dragon whatever you want, but no changing names once they're selected (to avoid confusion) and the dragon can be male or female NO SEX CHANGES ALLOWED basically pick a gender for your dragon and keep it that way. Dragons are also INTELLIGENT and can SPEAK they are by no means beasts. Other than that have fun and enjoy.
